docs.title: Welcome to Bookshelf Documentation
docs.text: Bookshelf is a learning project for building REST APIs and writing clear, easy-to-understand documentation.

docs.title: About This Project
docs.text: This project builds two small REST APIs, one after the other. Each API teaches different things, but they both work with books and use the same basic structure.

docs.title: Project Goals
docs.text:
1. Learn Python by working with books
  2. Build simple REST APIs
  3. Write clear documentation that people can understand

docs.title: API 1 – Open Library Explorer
docs.text: The first API uses Open Library data that's been saved locally. This helps you work with real, messy data and learn to document an API when you don't control the data.

docs.title: API 2 – Personal Library API
docs.text: The second API works with a personal book collection. This helps you design an API when you own the data and can add stricter rules.

docs.title: My First Blog Post
docs.text:
This is my first blog post for the Bookshelf project.

More updates coming soon!
